address: Cambridge University Library, West Road, Cambridge, CB3 9DR
title: UL - Map Room
description:
The Map Department is home to the majority of Cambridge University Library's cartographic resources, from early printed and manuscript maps through to modern resources including Ordnance Survey digital map data.

The Room has specially designed tables and benches for viewing the collections largest items. It also houses the [card catalogue](https://www.lib.cam.ac.uk/collections/departments/maps/map-department-catalogues/card) and [Ordnance Survey Map Data](https://www.lib.cam.ac.uk/collections/departments/maps/ordnance-survey-digital-maps/os) PC. 

Staff are always on hand to help access the collection for both first time and experienced users.

Readers may use laptops and other connected devices in the Map Room at any desk. Plug sockets are provided in all the desks and benches.

It is possible to make arrangements, on application to a member of the staff in the Map Room at least 20 minutes prior to the time of closing, for the transfer of most material to the [Munby Rare Books Room](https://www.lib.cam.ac.uk/collections/departments/rare-books) for use there after the Map Room closes. Please note that it may not be possible to consult some of the largest items in the collection outside of the Map Room due to their size.

O﻿PENING TIMES

Monday to Thursday : 9am to 12:45pm and 2pm to 5:10pm\
Friday : 9am to 12:45pm and 2pm to 4:50pm
